6// ShaderVars.h:
7// Types to represent GL variables (varyings, uniforms, etc)
8//
9
10#ifndef GLSLANG_SHADERVARS_H_
11#define GLSLANG_SHADERVARS_H_
12
13#include <algorithm>
14#include <array>
15#include <string>
16#include <vector>
17
18// This type is defined here to simplify ANGLE's integration with glslang for SPIRv.
19using ShCompileOptions = uint64_t;
20
21namespace sh
22{
23// GLenum alias
24typedef unsigned int GLenum;
25
26// Varying interpolation qualifier, see section 4.3.9 of the ESSL 3.00.4 spec
27enum InterpolationType
28{
29 INTERPOLATION_SMOOTH,
30 INTERPOLATION_CENTROID,
31 INTERPOLATION_SAMPLE,
32 INTERPOLATION_FLAT,
33 INTERPOLATION_NOPERSPECTIVE
34};
35
36// Validate link & SSO consistency of interpolation qualifiers
37bool InterpolationTypesMatch(InterpolationType a, InterpolationType b);
38
39// Uniform block layout qualifier, see section 4.3.8.3 of the ESSL 3.00.4 spec
40enum BlockLayoutType
41{
42 BLOCKLAYOUT_STANDARD,
43 BLOCKLAYOUT_STD140 = BLOCKLAYOUT_STANDARD,
44 BLOCKLAYOUT_STD430, // Shader storage block layout qualifier
45 BLOCKLAYOUT_PACKED,
46 BLOCKLAYOUT_SHARED
47};
48
49// Interface Blocks, see section 4.3.9 of the ESSL 3.10 spec
50enum class BlockType
51{
52 BLOCK_UNIFORM,
53 BLOCK_BUFFER,
54
55 // Required in OpenGL ES 3.1 extension GL_OES_shader_io_blocks.
56 // TODO(jiawei.shao@intel.com): add BLOCK_OUT.
57 // Also used in GLSL
58 BLOCK_IN
59};
60
61// Base class for all variables defined in shaders, including Varyings, Uniforms, etc
62// Note: we must override the copy constructor and assignment operator so we can
63// work around excessive GCC binary bloating:
64// See https://code.google.com/p/angleproject/issues/detail?id=697
65struct ShaderVariable
66{
67 ShaderVariable();
68 ShaderVariable(GLenum typeIn);
69 ShaderVariable(GLenum typeIn, unsigned int arraySizeIn);
70 ~ShaderVariable();
71 ShaderVariable(const ShaderVariable &other);
72 ShaderVariable &operator=(const ShaderVariable &other);
73 bool operator==(const ShaderVariable &other) const;
74 bool operator!=(const ShaderVariable &other) const { return !operator==(other); }
75
76 bool isArrayOfArrays() const { return arraySizes.size() >= 2u; }
77 bool isArray() const { return !arraySizes.empty(); }
78 unsigned int getArraySizeProduct() const;
79 // Return the inner array size product.
80 // For example, if there's a variable declared as size 3 array of size 4 array of size 5 array
81 // of int:
82 // int a[3][4][5];
83 // then getInnerArraySizeProduct of a would be 4*5.
84 unsigned int getInnerArraySizeProduct() const;
85
86 // Array size 0 means not an array when passed to or returned from these functions.
87 // Note that setArraySize() is deprecated and should not be used inside ANGLE.
88 unsigned int getOutermostArraySize() const { return isArray() ? arraySizes.back() : 0; }
89 void setArraySize(unsigned int size);
90
91 // Turn this ShaderVariable from an array into a specific element in that array. Will update
92 // flattenedOffsetInParentArrays.
93 void indexIntoArray(unsigned int arrayIndex);
94
95 // Get the nth nested array size from the top. Caller is responsible for range checking
96 // arrayNestingIndex.
97 unsigned int getNestedArraySize(unsigned int arrayNestingIndex) const;
98
99 // This function should only be used with variables that are of a basic type or an array of a
100 // basic type. Shader interface variables that are enumerated according to rules in GLES 3.1
101 // spec section 7.3.1.1 page 77 are fine. For those variables the return value should match the
102 // ARRAY_SIZE value that can be queried through the API.
103 unsigned int getBasicTypeElementCount() const;
104
105 unsigned int getExternalSize() const;
106
107 bool isStruct() const { return !fields.empty(); }
108
109 // All of the shader's variables are described using nested data
110 // structures. This is needed in order to disambiguate similar looking
111 // types, such as two structs containing the same fields, but in
112 // different orders. "findInfoByMappedName" provides an easy query for
113 // users to dive into the data structure and fetch the unique variable
114 // instance corresponding to a dereferencing chain of the top-level
115 // variable.
116 // Given a mapped name like 'a[0].b.c[0]', return the ShaderVariable
117 // that defines 'c' in |leafVar|, and the original name 'A[0].B.C[0]'
118 // in |originalName|, based on the assumption that |this| defines 'a'.
119 // If no match is found, return false.
120 bool findInfoByMappedName(const std::string &mappedFullName,
121 const ShaderVariable **leafVar,
122 std::string *originalFullName) const;
123
124 // Find the child field which matches 'fullName' == var.name + "." + field.name.
125 // Return nullptr if not found.
126 const sh::ShaderVariable *findField(const std::string &fullName, uint32_t *fieldIndexOut) const;
127
128 bool isBuiltIn() const;
129 bool isEmulatedBuiltIn() const;
130
131 GLenum type;
132 GLenum precision;
133 std::string name;
134 std::string mappedName;
135
136 // Used to make an array type. Outermost array size is stored at the end of the vector.
137 std::vector<unsigned int> arraySizes;
138
139 // Offset of this variable in parent arrays. In case the parent is an array of arrays, the
140 // offset is outerArrayElement * innerArraySize + innerArrayElement.
141 // For example, if there's a variable declared as size 3 array of size 4 array of int:
142 // int a[3][4];
143 // then the flattenedOffsetInParentArrays of a[2] would be 2.
144 // and flattenedOffsetInParentArrays of a[2][1] would be 2*4 + 1 = 9.
145 int parentArrayIndex() const
146 {
147 return hasParentArrayIndex() ? flattenedOffsetInParentArrays : 0;
148 }
149
150 void setParentArrayIndex(int indexIn) { flattenedOffsetInParentArrays = indexIn; }
151
152 bool hasParentArrayIndex() const { return flattenedOffsetInParentArrays != -1; }
153
154 // Static use means that the variable is accessed somewhere in the shader source.
155 bool staticUse;
156 // A variable is active unless the compiler determined that it is not accessed by the shader.
157 // All active variables are statically used, but not all statically used variables are
158 // necessarily active. GLES 3.0.5 section 2.12.6. GLES 3.1 section 7.3.1.
159 bool active;
160 std::vector<ShaderVariable> fields;
161 std::string structName;
162
163 // Only applies to interface block fields. Kept here for simplicity.
164 bool isRowMajorLayout;
165
166 // VariableWithLocation
167 int location;
168
169 // Uniform
170 int binding;
171 // Decide whether two uniforms are the same at shader link time,
172 // assuming one from vertex shader and the other from fragment shader.
173 // GLSL ES Spec 3.00.3, section 4.3.5.
174 // GLSL ES Spec 3.10.4, section 4.4.5
175 bool isSameUniformAtLinkTime(const ShaderVariable &other) const;
176 GLenum imageUnitFormat;
177 int offset;
178 bool readonly;
179 bool writeonly;
180
181 // OutputVariable
182 // From EXT_blend_func_extended.
183 int index;
184
185 // InterfaceBlockField
186 // Decide whether two InterfaceBlock fields are the same at shader
187 // link time, assuming one from vertex shader and the other from
188 // fragment shader.
189 // See GLSL ES Spec 3.00.3, sec 4.3.7.
190 bool isSameInterfaceBlockFieldAtLinkTime(const ShaderVariable &other) const;
191
192 // Varying
193 InterpolationType interpolation;
194 bool isInvariant;
195 // Decide whether two varyings are the same at shader link time,
196 // assuming one from vertex shader and the other from fragment shader.
197 // Invariance needs to match only in ESSL1. Relevant spec sections:
198 // GLSL ES 3.00.4, sections 4.6.1 and 4.3.9.
199 // GLSL ES 1.00.17, section 4.6.4.
200 bool isSameVaryingAtLinkTime(const ShaderVariable &other, int shaderVersion) const;
201 // Deprecated version of isSameVaryingAtLinkTime, which assumes ESSL1.
202 bool isSameVaryingAtLinkTime(const ShaderVariable &other) const;
203
204 // If the variable is a sampler that has ever been statically used with texelFetch
205 bool texelFetchStaticUse;
206
207 protected:
208 bool isSameVariableAtLinkTime(const ShaderVariable &other,
209 bool matchPrecision,
210 bool matchName) const;
211
212 int flattenedOffsetInParentArrays;
213};
214
215// TODO: anglebug.com/3899
216// For backwards compatibility for other codebases (e.g., chromium/src/gpu/command_buffer/service)
217using Uniform = ShaderVariable;
218using Attribute = ShaderVariable;
219using OutputVariable = ShaderVariable;
220using InterfaceBlockField = ShaderVariable;
221using Varying = ShaderVariable;
222
223struct InterfaceBlock
224{
225 InterfaceBlock();
226 ~InterfaceBlock();
227 InterfaceBlock(const InterfaceBlock &other);
228 InterfaceBlock &operator=(const InterfaceBlock &other);
229
230 // Fields from blocks with non-empty instance names are prefixed with the block name.
231 std::string fieldPrefix() const;
232 std::string fieldMappedPrefix() const;
233
234 // Decide whether two interface blocks are the same at shader link time.
235 bool isSameInterfaceBlockAtLinkTime(const InterfaceBlock &other) const;
236
237 bool isBuiltIn() const;
238
239 bool isArray() const { return arraySize > 0; }
240 unsigned int elementCount() const { return std::max(1u, arraySize); }
241
242 std::string name;
243 std::string mappedName;
244 std::string instanceName;
245 unsigned int arraySize;
246 BlockLayoutType layout;
247
248 // Deprecated. Matrix packing should only be queried from individual fields of the block.
249 // TODO(oetuaho): Remove this once it is no longer used in Chromium.
250 bool isRowMajorLayout;
251
252 int binding;
253 bool staticUse;
254 bool active;
255 BlockType blockType;
256 std::vector<ShaderVariable> fields;
257};
258
259struct WorkGroupSize
260{
261 // Must have a trivial default constructor since it is used in YYSTYPE.
262 inline WorkGroupSize() = default;
263 inline explicit constexpr WorkGroupSize(int initialSize);
264
265 void fill(int fillValue);
266 void setLocalSize(int localSizeX, int localSizeY, int localSizeZ);
267
268 int &operator[](size_t index);
269 int operator[](size_t index) const;
270 size_t size() const;
271
272 // Checks whether two work group size declarations match.
273 // Two work group size declarations are the same if the explicitly specified elements are the
274 // same or if one of them is specified as one and the other one is not specified
275 bool isWorkGroupSizeMatching(const WorkGroupSize &right) const;
276
277 // Checks whether any of the values are set.
278 bool isAnyValueSet() const;
279
280 // Checks whether all of the values are set.
281 bool isDeclared() const;
282
283 // Checks whether either all of the values are set, or none of them are.
284 bool isLocalSizeValid() const;
285
286 int localSizeQualifiers[3];
287};
288
289inline constexpr WorkGroupSize::WorkGroupSize(int initialSize)
290 : localSizeQualifiers{initialSize, initialSize, initialSize}
291{}
292
293} // namespace sh
294
295#endif // GLSLANG_SHADERVARS_H_
